title: 111_hr4951
content: PARTICIPATION OF PRESIDENT, VICE PRESIDENT, MEMBERS OF CONGRESS, POLITICAL APPOINTEES, AND CONGRESSIONAL STAFF IN THE EXCHANGE. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act is amended to allow the President, Vice President, political appointees, Members of Congress, and Congressional staff to enroll in a qualified health plan in the exchange. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act allows certain government officials to enroll in a qualified health plan through an Exchange in their state, with employer contributions only going to the issuer of the plan enrolled in through the Exchange. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act allows government officials to enroll in a health plan through an Exchange with employer contributions determined and adjusted for individual or family coverage. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act allows government officials to enroll in a health plan through an Exchange with adjusted employer contributions. Political appointees are defined as individuals employed in specific positions under title 5, United States Code. The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act allows government officials to enroll in a health plan through an Exchange with adjusted employer contributions. Political appointees are individuals in specific positions under title 5, United States Code, including those in the Executive Schedule, Senior Executive Service, or in confidential or policy-determining roles in the executive branch. The amendment made by this section in subpart C of part 213 of title 5 of the Code of Federal Regulations defines a 'Congressional employee' as an employee whose pay is disbursed by the Secretary of the Senate or the Chief Administrative Officer of the House of Representatives. This amendment will take effect as if included in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.
